question: List the functions of the protein lactotransferrin.
ideal_answer: Lactotransferrin has numerous biological roles, including the regulation of iron absorption and modulation of immune responses, and has anti-microbial, anti-viral, antioxidant, anti-cancer, and anti-inflammatory activities.

snippets.text: It has numerous biological roles, including the regulation of iron absorption and modulation of immune responses, and has anti-microbial, anti-viral, antioxidant, anti-cancer, and anti-inflammatory activities.
The tumor suppressor function of lactotransferrin (LTF) has been reported in a variety of tumors, including GC, nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) and prostate cancer.

Lactotransferrin (LTF) is a pleiotropic protein, expressed in various body tissues and fluids, which modulates the host immune-inflammatory response and bone metabolism, and might be involved in dental implant osseointegration

exact_answer: regulation of iron absorption, modulation of immune responses, anti-microbial, anti-viral, antioxidant, anti-cancer, anti-inflammatory
